title: Sticky keys mean one-fingered ctrl-alt-del
text:
Vista Tips 'Sticky Keys' Vista has a feature called sticky keys, which is enabled by quickly pressing the shift key five times. While sticky keys are active, Windows will pretend consecutive key presses happen simultaneously.

Vista has a feature called sticky keys, which is enabled by quickly pressing the shift key five times. While sticky keys are active, Windows will pretend consecutive key presses happen simultaneously.

We spoke to Microsoft Australia's Paul Randle for these tips and tricks.

Click here to return to the ZDNet Australia Windows Vista 10 top tricks and tips page.
description: Vista has a feature called sticky keys, which is enabled by quickly pressing the shift key five times. While sticky keys are active, Windows will pretend consecutive key presses happen simultaneously.
